keyword: how many calories in a poke bowl
title: How Many Calories in a Poke Bowl?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a poke bowl, including protein, carbs, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for a standard serving with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Poke Bowl?
assumptions: Standard poke bowl: 1 cup cooked white rice, 4 oz raw ahi tuna, mixed greens, cucumber, edamame, seaweed, sesame seeds; light soy-sesame dressing; no avocado.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion sizes, fish type, rice amount, and dressing; restaurant versions may differ. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard poke bowl has about 550 kcal, with 30 g protein from fish and 60 g carbs mainly from rice.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use salmon instead of tuna (4 oz)
Low-carb: replace rice with cauliflower rice

faqs.q: How many calories in a poke bowl with tuna?
faqs.a: About 550 kcal for a standard tuna poke bowl as described.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: Typically 30 g from the fish, plus some from edamame and rice.

faqs.q: Are poke bowls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to soy sauce and seasonings; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: How to make a poke bowl lower in calories?
faqs.a: Skip rice, use more veggies, lighter dressing, and leaner fish to reduce by 100-200 kcal.

faqs.q: Calories in a vegetarian poke bowl?
faqs.a: Around 400-500 kcal without fish, depending on tofu or veggies used instead.
